definition[0]: if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion
example[0]: The accident inclined him to reconsider his career.
definition[1]: to think that a particular belief or opinion is most likely to be correct
example[1]: I incline to accept the official version of events.
example[2]: I incline to the opinion that this principle extends to cases of religious discrimination.
definition[2]: to slope at a particular angle, or to make something do this
example[3]: The telescope is inclined at an angle of 43 degrees.
